results.title: Someone's in the kitchen with Jamie
results.creator_credit: Barra Grant, Elaine Sperber and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Relates to an adolescent boy’s struggle to remain a “boy” in the eyes of his basketball coach and team-mates, while he is undertaking a Home Economics course. Cast includes Don Kehr, Dixie Carter, William Russ.

results.title: Very good friends
results.creator_credit: Richard Bennett, Martin Tahse, Learning Corporation of America and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Based on the novel “Beat the Turtle Drum” by Constance Greene. Deals with a thirteen-year-old girl’s reactions to the death of her younger sister, to whom she was very close. Starring Melissa Sue Anderson, Katy Kurtzman.

results.title: Rodeo Red and the runaway
results.creator_credit: Bert Salzman, Doro Bachrach and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
A young adolescent girl unable to cope with the relationship between her father and her new stepmother, runs away from home and is taken in by a woman farmer living nearby. During this time she comes to terms with her mother’s death, her relationship with her stepmother and her own self-centred attitudes. Based on the book “Shelter from the wind” by Marion Dane Daver.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Salzman, Doro Bachrach and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: The Boy who liked deer
results.creator_credit: Barbara Loden and Material Worth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Three boys think nothing of their vandalism of school property and a deer park, until as a result of their crimes some deer die of food poisoning. Provides a personal look at the problem of vandalism by showing the teacher’s grief over the destruction of his classroom and the sorrow of one of the boys over the fate of the deer. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Schoolboy father
results.creator_credit: Arthur Allan Seidelman, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Adaptation of the book “He’s my baby now” by Jeanette Eyerly, which focuses on a 16-year-old boy and his dilemma after learning that he has fathered a child. Determined to fill the parental void for his child, he finds himself confronting some harsh realities. Stars Rob Lowe and Dana Plato.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Allan Seidelman, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions

results.title: Skating rink
results.creator_credit: Larry S. Elikann, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Tells the story of a teenage boy whose stammering and difficulty in communicating his feelings and thoughts were brought on by the death of his mother when he was a small boy. Shows how he develops confidence and a sense of achievement through learning to skate well and through his asociation with the couple who teach him to skate. Based on a novel by Mildred Lee. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry S. Elikann, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions

results.title: I'm not too famous at it: a definition of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson, Barrie Angus McLean and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Learning Series”.
The title was named by Robert, a bright nine year old, who lacks eye-hand coordination, has difficulty appreciating the characteristics of shapes and forms, has language difficulties of various kinds, who has poor gross motor coordination and other problems. While defining and describing these learning deficits indirectly shows somthing of the process of remediation.

group_siblings.title: Teaching the way they learn: remediation of learning disabilities (TEFC)

results.title: Teaching the way they learn: remediation of learning disabilities (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Learning Series”.
Dr. Sam Rabinovitch explains some of the methods used in teaching children with learning disabilities due to poor listening ability or poor bodily coordination. Points out how important it is that the child learns and understands what is being taught

results.title: It feels like you're left out of the world (TEFC): experiencing learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Robert Anderson Associates and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Learning Series”.
Children speak of their attitudes towards their own learning disabilities, and of the way in which their life has been affected by these disabilities. Articulates the personal and social consequences of having a learning problem - the feeling of being a failure is a classroom lesson that many of these children never forget. Shows that the children given time and special help, their problems can be overcome.
